Detailed Description

template<class TBase>
class WTL::CScrollBarT< TBase >

The scroll bar control.

This class encapsulates the functionality of a Windows scroll bar control, which is a rectangular control that contains a scroll box, or thumb, and has direction arrows at both ends. A user can scroll through a document by tapping the arrows with the stylus or by dragging the scroll box.

Definition at line 1394 of file atlctrls.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<class TBase>
WTL::CScrollBarT< TBase >::CScrollBarT (  HWND    hWnd = NULL )  [inline]
 

Constructor.

This constructor creates an instance of a CScrollBar object. After constructing the object, call the Create method to create and initialize the Windows scroll bar. You may also assign a scroll bar window handle to the object.

Parameters:
hWnd  A Window handle.

Definition at line 1398 of file atlctrls.h.

Member Function Documentation

template<class TBase>
HWND WTL::CScrollBarT< TBase >::Create (  HWND    hWndParent,
_U_RECT    rect = NULL,
LPCTSTR    szWindowName = NULL,
DWORD    dwStyle = 0,
DWORD    dwExStyle = 0,
_U_MENUorID    MenuOrID = 0U,
LPVOID    lpCreateParam = NULL
)  [inline]
 

Creates a new scroll bar.

This method creates and initializes a Windows scroll bar and attaches it to the CScrollBarT object

To construct a CScrollBar object, call the constructor, which constructs the CScrollBarT object, then call Create, which creates and initializes the associated Windows scroll bar and attaches it to the CScrollBar object.

Parameters:
hWndParent  A Window handle to the parent/owner.
rect  Specifies the size and position of the scroll bar. Can be either a RECT structure or a CRect object.
szWindowName  Should be NULL.
dwStyle  The Window style of the scroll bar.
dwExStyle  Extended Window style.
MenuOrID  Specifies the control ID of the scroll bar.
lpCreateParam  Optional parameter.
Returns:
The new scroll bar window handle.

template<class TBase>
BOOL WTL::CScrollBarT< TBase >::GetScrollInfo (  LPSCROLLINFO    lpScrollInfo )  const [inline]
 

Retrives information about the scroll bar.

This method retrieves the information that the SCROLLINFO structure maintains about a scroll bar. GetScrollInfo enables applications to use 32-bit scroll positions.

Parameters:
lpScrollInfo  Specifies a pointer to a SCROLLINFO structure.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

Definition at line 1449 of file atlctrls.h.

template<class TBase>
int WTL::CScrollBarT< TBase >::GetScrollPos (    )  const [inline]
 

Retrieves the current position.

This method retrieves the current position of a scroll box. The current position is a relative value that depends on the current scrolling range. For example, if the scrolling range is 100 to 200 and the scroll box is in the middle of the bar, the current position is 150.

Returns:
Specifies the current position of the scroll box if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

Definition at line 1419 of file atlctrls.h.

template<class TBase>
void WTL::CScrollBarT< TBase >::GetScrollRange (  LPINT    lpMinPos,
LPINT    lpMaxPos
)  const [inline]
 

Retrives the scroll range.

This method copies the current minimum and maximum scroll-bar positions for the specified scroll bar to the locations specified by lpMinPos and lpMaxPos.

The default range for a scroll-bar control is empty; that is, both values are zero.

Parameters:
lpMinPos  Points to the integer variable that is to receive the minimum position.
lpMaxPos  Points to the integer variable that is to receive the maximum position.

Definition at line 1400 of file atlctrls.h.

template<class TBase>
int WTL::CScrollBarT< TBase >::SetScrollInfo (  LPSCROLLINFO    lpScrollInfo,
BOOL    bRedraw = TRUE
)  [inline]
 

Sets scroll bar information.

This method sets the information that the SCROLLINFO structure maintains about a scroll bar. You must provide the values required by the SCROLLINFO structure parameters, including the flag values.

The SCROLLINFO structure contains information about a scroll bar, including the minimum and maximum scrolling positions, the page size, and the position of the scroll box (the thumb). See the SCROLLINFO structure for more information about changing the structure defaults.

Parameters:
lpScrollInfo  Specifies a pointer to a SCROLLINFO structure.
bRedraw  Specifies whether the scroll bar should be redrawn to reflect the new information. If bRedraw is TRUE, the scroll bar is redrawn. If it is FALSE, it is not redrawn. The scroll bar is redrawn by default.
Returns:
If successful, the return is TRUE. Otherwise, it is FALSE.

Definition at line 1444 of file atlctrls.h.

template<class TBase>
int WTL::CScrollBarT< TBase >::SetScrollPos (  int    nPos,
BOOL    bRedraw = TRUE
)  [inline]
 

Sets the current position.

This method sets the current position of a scroll box to that specified by nPos, and redraw the scroll bar to reflect the new position.

Set bRedraw to FALSE whenever the scroll bar will be redrawn by a subsequent call to another method to avoid having the scroll bar redrawn twice within a short interval.

Parameters:
nPos  Specifies the new position for the scroll box. It must be within the scrolling range.
bRedraw  Specifies whether the scroll bar should be redrawn to reflect the new position. If bRedraw is TRUE, the scroll bar is redrawn. If it is FALSE, it is not redrawn. The scroll bar is redrawn by default.
Returns:
Specifies the previous position of the scroll box if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

Definition at line 1424 of file atlctrls.h.

template<class TBase>
void WTL::CScrollBarT< TBase >::SetScrollRange (  int    nMinPos,
int    nMaxPos,
BOOL    bRedraw = TRUE
)  [inline]
 

Sets the scroll range.

This method sets minimum and maximum position values for the specified scroll bar. Set nMinPos and nMaxPos to zero to hide standard scroll bars.

Do not call this method to hide a scroll bar while processing a scroll-bar notification message.

If a call to SetScrollRange immediately follows a call to the SetScrollPos method, set bRedraw in SetScrollPos to zero to prevent the scroll bar from being redrawn twice.

The difference between the values specified by nMinPos and nMaxPos must not be greater than 32,767. The default range for a scroll-bar control is empty; that is, both nMinPos and nMaxPos are zero.

Parameters:
nMinPos  Specifies the minimum scrolling position.
nMaxPos  Specifies the maximum scrolling position.
bRedraw  Specifies whether the scroll bar should be redrawn to reflect the change. If bRedraw is TRUE, the scroll bar is redrawn; if FALSE, it is not redrawn. It is redrawn by default.

Definition at line 1434 of file atlctrls.h.

template<class TBase>
void WTL::CScrollBarT< TBase >::ShowScrollBar (  BOOL    bShow = TRUE )  [inline]
 

Shows or hides the scroll bar.

This method shows or hides a scroll bar.

An application should not call this method to hide a scroll bar while processing a scroll-bar notification message.

Parameters:
bShow  Specifies whether the scroll bar is shown or hidden. If this parameter is TRUE, the scroll bar is shown; otherwise, it is hidden.
